title: Fluids and Lubricants - Additional information

body.body: Fluids and Lubricants - Additional information
This document details the fluids and lubricants quantities and grades required for each model.

Additional parts, such as filters or sealing washers, may be required to complete some tasks. Refer to the Owner's Handbook or Service Manual (available to www.triumphtechnicalinformation.co.uk) for more information, or refer to a competent person with the specialist knowledge and technical understanding of motorcycles, such as an authorised Triumph dealer.
Brake Fluid
The brake fluid quantity specified is sufficient to replace the brake fluid in the front and rear brakes, and the clutch fluid on models fitted with a hydraulic clutch.
Coolant

The coolant quantity specified is sufficient to replace the coolant. Models that previously listed HD4X HOAT coolant now list D2053 OAT coolant. The cooling system must be flushed with clean water before replacing coolant.
Drive Chain Lubricant (models with chain final drive)
Drive Chain lubricant should be used as directed in the Owner's handbook.
The engine oil grade specified must be used.
Using the incorrect engine oil grade may result in engine damage.
Engine Oil
The engine oil quantity specified is sufficient to replace the engine oil and filter. Additional engine oil may be required if the engine has been dismantled.
Final Drive Oil (models with shaft drive)
The final drive oil quantity specified is sufficient to replace the final drive oil.
Fork Oil
The fork oil quantity specified is sufficient to replace the oil in both forks. It is recommended to measure the fork oil height when changing fork oil. Fork oil quantity is given as a guide only.
On some models the fork oil quantity may differ between each fork leg, refer to the service manual for your model for more information.
